intro: Calliandra bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored calliandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescences. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, which bloom in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and the plant is often used in ornamental gardening. Calliandra bicolor is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, making it useful in soil enrichment.
